The following decomposition of a Cartesian product is useful for counting pairs of integers. Roughly speaking, the product below is partitioned by parallel lines on  $\mathbb{Z}\times \mathbb{Z}$ .
Lemma 3.4. Let  $n\in \mathbb{N}$  and let  $I = \{1,2,\ldots ,n - 1\}$ . For every  $a,b\in \mathbb{Z}$ , we have

$$
I\times I = \bigoplus_{\stackrel{n}{a}}\bigoplus_{\stackrel{1\leq t\leq \frac{n}{d},}{(t,\frac{n}{d}) = 1}}\{(x,y)\in I\times I\mid ax + by\equiv td\pmod {n}\} .
$$
